description: Senior House at the centre of the school dates from late 18th century. Previously a Convent school (attended by Dusty Springfield in the 50s) after extensive renovation with surrounding new buildings, the school opened in 2020.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The creation of Ealing Fields High School involved the refurbishment of a Grade II listed manor and servants’ quarters, along with substantial new build elements, to become a new 750 place secondary school in West London.

The site of Ealing Fields High School has an interesting history attached to it. The house was originally called ‘Place House’ and was built in the 1600s. Later owners included William and Louisa Lawrence (nee Senior) who were leaders in surgery and botany.

We renamed the main house ‘Senior House’ in honour of Louisa Lawrence, and the main teaching building is ‘Lawrence Wing’ after William Lawrence. By naming the buildings after these two individuals, we are really pleased to be celebrating the spirit of intellectual curiosity and enlightenment which they represent.

Within Senior House, rooms were retained and restored with significant historic fabric, for example a decorative lounge linked to Queen Victoria was retained as parlour space, resulting in a school which bursts with character.

factsheet.heading: Refurbishment
paragraphs: The project team worked together to develop a bespoke brief with the Ealing Council Conservation Officer and English Heritage, which balanced efficient reuse and sensitivity to historic assets. The design retained the listed Place House, the 18th century Gate House and the Folly, and particular care was expended on the technical aspects of the project.

New buildings now link to Senior House on two storeys and consist of a main teaching block and sports hub with community access. The design is in keeping with the existing heritage with large areas of brickwork, portrait windows, and brick piers and detailing around entrances.

factsheet.heading: Famous Links
paragraphs: Dusty Springfield (1939-1999), a successful soul and rock singer and record producer, was educated at St Anne’s Convent School, Northfields which previously occupied the site. There is a green Ealing Civic Society plaque at the entrance to Ealing Fields High School.
